title: The Lincoln Project
deleted: * ''[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=10EGAMmriOg David Sirota: Lincoln Project Epic Fails As More Republicans Vote Trump]'', [[The Hill (newspaper)#Hill TV|Hill TV]] with [[David Sirota]]

title: The Lincoln Project
deleted: According to the [[National Review]] after registered Democratic voters in [[Pennsylvania]], [[Arizona]], [[Florida]], and [[Alaska]] received emails threatening violence if they were not to vote for [[Donald Trump]] in the [[2020 United States presidential election]] from an email address claiming to be the [[Proud Boys]] the anti-Trump [[Lincoln Project]] capitalized on the news, tweeting out that “the Proud Boys are attempting to scare voters away from the polls. The Lincoln Project tweet amassed over 12,000 retweets, but eventually deleted the claim after [[FBI]] director [[Chris Wray]] and Director of National Intelligence [[John Ratcliffe]] revealed in an emergency press conference Wednesday night that [[Russia]] and [[Iran]] had obtained “some voter-registration information” that Iran was already using to send the emails in an attempt to spread disinformation.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Hoonhout |first1=Tobias |title=Media, Lincoln Project Inadvertently Further Iranian ‘Proud Boys’ Disinformation Campaign |url=https://www.nationalreview.com/news/media-lincoln-project-inadvertently-further-iranian-proud-boys-disinformation-campaign/ |website=www.nationalreview.com |publisher=National Review |accessdate=November 8, 2020}}</ref>

title: The Lincoln Project
added: Democratic strategist [[James Carville]] praised the group for being more efficient and aggressive than Democratic PACs, saying: "Let me tell you, the Lincoln group and ''[[The Bulwark (website)|The Bulwark]]'', these Never Trumper Republicans, the Democrats could learn a lot from them. They're mean. They fight hard. And we don't fight like that."<ref>{{Cite web |title=James Carville Praises Group Behind 'Mourning in America' Video Attacking Donald Trump's Response to Coronavirus |url=https://popculture.com/trending/news/james-carville-praises-group-behind-mourning-in-america-video-donald-trump-response-coronavirus/ |website=PopCulture}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=May 6, 2020 |title=Carville: Democrats Could Learn A Lot From Never Trump Republicans, "We Don't Fight Like That" |url=https://www.realclearpolitics.com/video/2020/05/06/carville_democrats_could_learn_a_lot_about_never_trump_republicans_we_dont_fight_like_that.html |website=[[RealClearPolitics]]}}</ref> ''[[The New Republic]]'' wrote that "they make punches that Democratic officials and operatives often seem inclined to pull".<ref>{{cite news|first=Osita|last=Nwanevu|title=The Lincoln Project Doesn’t Matter|date=July 27, 2020|work=The New Republic|url=https://newrepublic.com/article/158632/lincoln-project-doesnt-matter|accessdate=November 10, 2020}}</ref>

Writing in ''[[The Washington Post]]'', [[Jennifer Rubin (journalist)|Jennifer Rubin]] said the Lincoln Project stood "head and shoulders above all the rest in the hard work of beating back President Trump and [[Trumpism]]" and wrote of the group's founders: "They made their careers helping to elect Republicans, but in the era of Trump, they have put partisanship aside in the cause of patriotism and defense of American democracy. Their ads have been the most effective and memorable of the presidential campaign, singeing Trump in a way Democrats have not quite mastered."<ref name=RubinJune21/> Author and columnist [[Max Boot]] praised the Lincoln Project for "turning out brilliant videos at a relentless pace that puts most political organizations to shame" and for seeking to demolish "the Trumpified GOP" and replace it with "a sane and sober [[center-right]] party in America."<ref name=Boot>Max Boot, [https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2020/07/22/lincoln-project-is-trying-save-republican-party-itself/ The Lincoln Project understands that Trump’s enablers must pay a price], ''Washington Post'' (July 22, 2020).</ref> Boot wrote that the Lincoln Project's founders, by "leading the charge against the Republican Party, ... have shown greater fealty to conservative principles than 99 percent of elected Republicans."<ref name=Boot/>

The Lincoln Project was criticized by former Romney campaign staffer [[Oren Cass]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Conservative think tank director says Lincoln Project members beholden to pro-business Republicans |url=https://thehill.com/hilltv/rising/508761-conservative-think-tank-director-says-lincoln-project-members-are-beholden-to |work=The Hill |date=July 28, 2020}}</ref> Writing in ''[[The Atlantic]]'', [[Andrew Ferguson]] described the ads as "personally abusive, overwrought, pointlessly salacious, and trip-wired with non sequiturs."<ref name=Ferguson/> [[Jeet Heer]] wrote in ''[[The Nation]]'' that "To the extent that the ads articulate any political vision, it is a desire to return to the hard-line military aggression of the [[Presidency of George W. Bush|George W. Bush era]]."<ref name="nation-lincoln" />
